page.title: 06CHURCH AND CHAPEL
page.content:
The{Church}in{Merton}has been a place of Christian worship for more than 700 years.The first recorded Rector,John de Mertone,was instituted in 1261.The{Church},with its dedication to All Saints,is built in the Perpendicular style,contains some intersting stained glass and has a ring of six bells. There is also a small and ancient{Church }at {Huish}.
During the late 18th.Century itinerant Methodist preachers visiting {Merton}held services in The Long Room adjoining the churchyard (now the{ {Parish Hall}) with it appears the consent of the Rector and Lord Clinton's Steward.Today Methodists worship in a fine{Chapel}built near Ryall's Corner,about a mile from the village. There is also a small{Chapel at Langham Cross in {Dolton}parish.
